intro: Cuervea granatensis, commonly known as the granate cuervea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red bracts that surround its small, yellow flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed beyond its native range.
